means: 哀悼者，送葬者( mourner的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: John Major and the Duke of Edinburgh led the mourners.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰·梅杰和爱丁堡公爵走在送葬队伍前面。

sentence.Network_en: Mourners are to stage a candlelit vigil in Liverpool.
sentence.Network_cn: 哀悼者准备在利物浦筹备举行一次烛光祈祷。

sentence.Network_en: The coffins stood in the baking heat surrounded by mourners.
sentence.Network_cn: 棺材放在炽热的太阳下，周围是哀悼的人们。

PerfectNetExp.abs: I chose out their way , and sat chief , and dwelt as a king in the army , as one that comforter the mourners .我为他们选择道路、又坐首位．我如君王在军队中居住．又如吊丧的安慰伤心的人。
mourners lashed at Israeli Prime Minister Ariel Sharon -- calling him the " head of the snake " -- and at President Bush and the United States .哀悼的人们猛烈抨击以色列总理沙龙和布什总统及美国，并指称沙龙为“蛇头”。
all of the mourners were dressed in black / They were all dressed in black .所有哀悼的人都穿着黑衣服[他们全穿着黑衣服]。
丧家 funerals丧家 mourners丧尸 zombie

list.abs: the mourners were wailing loudly .送葬的人都嚎啕大哭。
The detective posed mourner at the victim ' s funeral., 那侦探佯装成吊唁者参加了受害人的葬礼.

all mourners stood to attention at the end of the mourning ceremony as the coffins were carried amid a slow dirge to white eight hearses which left the airport for the Babaoshan Revolutionary Cemetery in western Beijing .哀悼仪式/追悼会最后，8位警察的灵柩被抬着从缓慢的哀乐中穿过走向白色
The mourners were wailing loudly ., 送葬的人都嚎啕大哭.

entry.tran: 送葬者，哀悼者(尤指逝者的亲戚、朋友)
entry.def: A mourner is a person who attends a funeral, especially as a relative or friend of the dead person.
